---
title: "Logging"
---
<div set:html={`
          <section id="logging">
<h1>Logging<a class="headerlink" href="#logging" title="Link to this heading">¶</a></h1>
<p>Algorand Python provides a <a class="reference internal" href="../api-algopy.html#algopy.log"><span class="std std-ref"><code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">log</span></code> method</span></a> that allows you to emit debugging and event information as well as return values from your contracts to the caller.</p>
<p>This <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">log</span></code> method is a superset of the <a class="reference internal" href="../lg-ops.html"><span class="std std-doc">AVM <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">log</span></code> method</span></a> that adds extra functionality:</p>
<ul class="simple">
<li><p>You can log multiple items rather than a single item</p></li>
<li><p>Items are concatenated together with an optional separator (which defaults to: <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">""</span></code>)</p></li>
<li><p>Items are automatically converted to bytes for you</p></li>
<li><p>Support for:</p>
<ul>
<li><p><code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">int</span></code> literals / module variables (encoded as raw bytes, not ASCII)</p></li>
<li><p><code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">UInt64</span></code> values (encoded as raw bytes, not ASCII)</p></li>
<li><p><code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">str</span></code> literals / module variables (encoded as UTF-8)</p></li>
<li><p><code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">bytes</span></code> literals / module variables (encoded as is)</p></li>
<li><p><code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">Bytes</span></code> values (encoded as is)</p></li>
<li><p><code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">BytesBacked</span></code> values, which includes <a class="reference internal" href="../api-algopy.html#algopy.String"><span class="std std-ref"><code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">String</span></code></span></a>, <a class="reference internal" href="../api-algopy.html#algopy.BigUInt"><span class="std std-ref"><code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">BigUInt</span></code></span></a>, <a class="reference internal" href="../api-algopy.html#algopy.Account"><span class="std std-ref"><code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">Account</span></code></span></a> and all of the <a class="reference internal" href="../api-algopy.arc4.html"><span class="std std-doc">ARC-4 types</span></a> (encoded as their underlying bytes values)</p></li>
</ul>
</li>
</ul>
<p>Logged values are <a class="reference external" href="https://developer.algorand.org/docs/rest-apis/algod/#pendingtransactionresponse">available to the calling client</a> and attached to the transaction record stored on the blockchain ledger.</p>
<p>If you want to emit ARC-28 events in the logs then there is a <a class="reference internal" href="../lg-arc28.html"><span class="std std-doc">purpose-built function for that</span></a>.</p>
<p>Here’s an example contract that uses the log method in various ways:</p>
<div class="highlight-python notranslate"><div class="highlight"><pre><span></span><span class="kn">from</span> <span class="nn">algopy</span> <span class="kn">import</span> <span class="n">BigUInt</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">Bytes</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">Contract</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">log</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">op</span>

<span class="k">class</span> <span class="nc">MyContract</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">Contract</span><span class="p">):</span>
    <span class="k">def</span> <span class="nf">approval_program</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="bp">self</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">-&gt;</span> <span class="nb">bool</span><span class="p">:</span>
        <span class="n">log</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">)</span>
        <span class="n">log</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="sa">b</span><span class="s2">"1"</span><span class="p">)</span>
        <span class="n">log</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"2"</span><span class="p">)</span>
        <span class="n">log</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">op</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">Txn</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">num_app_args</span> <span class="o">+</span> <span class="mi">3</span><span class="p">)</span>
        <span class="n">log</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">Bytes</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="sa">b</span><span class="s2">"4"</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="k">if</span> <span class="n">op</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">Txn</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">num_app_args</span> <span class="k">else</span> <span class="n">Bytes</span><span class="p">())</span>
        <span class="n">log</span><span class="p">(</span>
            <span class="sa">b</span><span class="s2">"5"</span><span class="p">,</span>
            <span class="mi">6</span><span class="p">,</span>
            <span class="n">op</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">Txn</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">num_app_args</span> <span class="o">+</span> <span class="mi">7</span><span class="p">,</span>
            <span class="n">BigUInt</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">8</span><span class="p">),</span>
            <span class="n">Bytes</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="sa">b</span><span class="s2">"9"</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="k">if</span> <span class="n">op</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">Txn</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">num_app_args</span> <span class="k">else</span> <span class="n">Bytes</span><span class="p">(),</span>
            <span class="n">sep</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s2">"_"</span><span class="p">,</span>
        <span class="p">)</span>
        <span class="k">return</span> <span class="kc">True</span>

    <span class="k">def</span> <span class="nf">clear_state_program</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="bp">self</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">-&gt;</span> <span class="nb">bool</span><span class="p">:</span>
        <span class="k">return</span> <span class="kc">True</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</section>

        `} />
